title: Boxer said 'nobody will believe a 5-year-old' as he beat ex in front of daughter
text:

A former boxing champion beat up his ex-girlfriend in front of her five-year-old daughter, during a terrifying revenge campaign.

Lee Mitchell barged his way into the woman's home, slapped her across the face then dragged her round the floor by her hair after being left enraged that they had split up three days earlier.

When the victim's child came into the living room and witnessed the assault, Mitchell, 25, shouted: "No one will believe a five year old" before chasing the terrified woman into her bedroom.

As mother and child tried to dodge Mitchell's advances and call police, he told them: "They can give me a lift home" before he hurled a mattress at them.

(Image: Lee Mitchell/ Cavendish Press (M)

A policewoman and colleagues arrived at the house in Bolton, but Mitchell sunk his teeth into the female officer's hand during a struggle telling her: "You didn’t expect that did you?"

He was later bailed but returned to the victim's home to terrorise her and then subsequently ambushed her during a shopping trip saying: "I’m going to smash your windows tonight and strangle you."

In a statement, his victim said of her daughter: "She has become more clingy as a result of what happened - I don't want him in my life or my daughter's."

Mitchell, from Breightmet, Bolton was previously a North West bantomweight boxing champion.

At Manchester magistrates court, he was jailed for 24 weeks after he was convicted of assault, criminal damage and harassment.

(Image: Lee Mitchell/ Cavendish Press (M)

He was also banned from contacting the victim under the terms of a two year restraining order.

The court heard the couple had been in a romance for five months but split up on May 1 following a series of arguments.

Steven Connor, defending, said: "He is adamant the complainant has bombarded him with texts.

"When bailed initially by the court he should have resisted, should have been stronger and stayed away and he regrets what he did.

(Image: Lee Mitchell/ Cavendish Press (M)

"He recognises this toxic relationship with this lady is utterly and completely at an end."

Sentencing, magistrates told Mitchell: "These offences are so serious that custody is the only option.

"It was sustained attack on an ex partner in the presence of her child and then the violent assault of police officers going about their normal every day duties."

Mitchell was also ordered to pay £100 compensation to the policewoman.
description: Ex-boxing champion Lee Mitchell, 25, barged his way into his victim's home enraged that she broke up with him three days earlier
